content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can define a function `clean_column` to clean column names as follows:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the string
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = strip(col)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, r"\s|-" => "_")
    
    return col
end
```

This function takes a `String` as input and returns the cleaned column name. It first lowercases the string, then strips any leading or trailing whitespace using `strip()`, which is a built-in Julia function that removes both leading and trailing whitespaces in one call. Finally, it replaces spaces and hyphens with underscores using `replace()`.

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
julia> clean_column("My Column")
"my_column"
```

This will return "my_column" after applying the cleaning steps defined in the `clean_column` function.
